alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Jackson; Jones (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 1:22PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clinton, southwestern Jackson and eastern Jones Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 122 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wyoming, or 14 miles east of Anamosa, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, minor flooding and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding. Locations impacted include... Wyoming, Oxford Junction, Lost Nation, Onslow, Monmouth, Center Junction, Canton, Baldwin, Oxford Mills, Pictured Rocks Wildlife Area, Eden Valley Refuge, Hale, Camp Courageous, Scotch Grove, and Temple Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforecement. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
